intro: Hieraciodes andersonii, commonly known as Anderson's hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
